meanings.sent1: The company tried to misbrand their products to make them seem healthier than they actually were.
meanings.sent2: It is illegal to misbrand food items with false information on the labels.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally misbranded the expiration date on the milk carton, causing confusion in the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: Her attempt to misbrand her mediocre artwork as a masterpiece fooled no one.
meanings.sent5: The consequences of a company's decision to misbrand their products can be severe.

meanings.definition: To give a false or misleading description of a product.
meanings.sent1: The advertisement misbrands the new phone as the fastest on the market.
meanings.sent2: Consumers can file complaints if they believe a company is misbranding their products.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that the magician would misbrand a rock as a diamond to impress the audience.
meanings.sent4: The politician's attempt to misbrand his opponent's policies backfired.
meanings.sent5: The company faced a lawsuit for continuously misbranding their supplements as a cure-all.

meanings.definition: The act of mislabeling or misrepresenting a product.
meanings.sent1: The misbrand of the toy led to a product recall due to safety concerns.
meanings.sent2: Customers were disappointed by the misbrand of the clothing item, as it did not match the online description.
meanings.sent3: The misbrand of the car model as 'fuel-efficient' turned out to be a marketing gimmick.
meanings.sent4: The misbrand of the software as 'user-friendly' left many users frustrated with its complexity.
meanings.sent5: The misbrand of the medication caused confusion among patients, leading to incorrect dosages.
